tweets.content:
The migration of Legacy Vaults to Ember Protocol Vaults has begun!

With the launch of the eBLUE Vault on @EmberProtocol_, the Legacy Vaults will be sunset over the next two weeks. All users must withdraw funds before October 23, 1:00 pm UTC. Final claims will be processed on October 24, and the legacy vaults page will be removed on October 25.

How to migrate your staked BLUE to eBLUE: learn.bluefin.io/bluefin/blu‚Ä¶

We thank you for your long-standing support of Bluefin and its legacy products, and we are excited for you to continue trading and earning on Bluefin!

tweets.content:
Disclaimer: All BLUE token buybacks are governed by BGP-5: the BLUE Buyback Framework Governance Proposal. Any information presented on the dashboard regarding buybacks is for informational purposes only and reflects past or completed activity. While future buybacks may occur pursuant to BGP-5 or subsequent governance proposals, this should not be interpreted as a guarantee, commitment, or promise of any such activity by Bluefin, its affiliates, or any related entities.

Token holders and market participants should not rely on historical or governance-approved buybacks as an indication of future activity.

Nothing on the dashboard constitutes financial advice or a solicitation to buy or sell BLUE tokens.
tweets.author: bluefinapp

tweets.content:
Introducing the BLUE token buyback program and dashboard!

Over the years, Bluefin has evolved into a multi-product ecosystem powering trading and liquidity across Sui. Today, it stands as the number one revenue-generating protocol on the network.

At the center of this growth is BLUE, which coordinates products, partners, and community governance. The buyback program serves as a mechanism to strengthen the DAO treasury and reinforce alignment between protocol adoption and governance.

From day one, our mission has been to build Bluefin into the most powerful onchain trading venue and ensure that protocol growth supports the long-term sustainability of the ecosystem.

BLUE Token Dashboard: tinyurl.com/Bluefin-Token-Da‚Ä¶
BGP-5: common.xyz/bluefin/discussio‚Ä¶

tweets.content:
5/ A special thank you to our community and partners for supporting us on this journey. Since 2020, we‚Äôve been building toward a vision of the most powerful on-chain trading venue. With the launch of Bluefin Pro, we‚Äôre closer than ever to that goal and proud to help power the new financial stack on Sui.

We are excited to see you try Bluefin Pro and look forward to hearing your feedback!
tweets.author: bluefinapp

tweets.content: 4/ Bluefin Perps Beta will continue to operate during the migration period, as outlined in the previous announcement.
tweets.author: bluefinapp

tweets.content:
3/ Access to Bluefin Pro is rolling out in three phases:

‚Ä¢ Early Access Round 1 - July 17 at 1:00 PM UTC: Bluefin Ambassadors, partner communities, Bluefin Leagues (Sapphire and Black league holders), BLUE Vault top 50 depositors, and 1,000 early access signups selected at random.
‚Ä¢ Early Access Round 2 - July 18 at 1:00 PM UTC: Remaining early access participants.
‚Ä¢ Public Launch of Bluefin Pro: Week of July 21!

As part of this launch, early access participants will benefit from reduced trading fees: 0% maker and 0.02% taker fees. These will revert to standard rates at public launch.
tweets.author: bluefinapp

tweets.content:
2/ At its core, Bluefin Pro combines Sui‚Äôs high-performance infrastructure with a new margining engine focused on capital efficiency. It supports both cross and isolated margin modes, allowing traders to manage capital and risk in ways that suit their strategies.

Bluefin Pro also introduces native USDC support, advanced trading tools, and a completely redesigned user interface.

Learn more about how Bluefin Pro works here: localhost:8080/bluefinapp/status/1917‚Ä¶
tweets.author: bluefinapp

tweets.content:
1/ Bluefin Pro is now live in early access!

Bluefin first launched perpetuals on @SuiNetwork in Q4 2023. Since then, the beta platform has processed over $55 billion in trading volume. Bluefin Pro is a complete reimagination of that platform, built from the ground up to deliver blazing-fast speed, trustless execution, on-chain transparency, and full self-custody.

tweets.content: 3/ Bluefin was born in 2020 with a vision to become the most powerful onchain trading venue, and this started with perps as our flagship product. Perpetual futures are the future of crypto markets, and we are seeing major institutions and companies, such as Robinhood and Coinbase, adopting perps into their core product strategies. Sui provides the scalability and performance needed to support this at a global scale, and Bluefin Pro will lead the way.
tweets.author: bluefinapp

tweets.content:
2/ The migration from the current Beta platform to Bluefin Pro will be part of Bluefin Governance Proposal 2 (BGP-2). Here‚Äôs everything you need to know about the migration:

‚Ä¢ July 11: First round of delistings on Beta (SEI, APT, TIA, POL, AVAX, ARB, TRUMP, DEEP, BLUE, SEND)
‚Ä¢ Week of July 15: Early access to Bluefin Pro opens
‚Ä¢ 3 Days After Early Access: Public launch of Bluefin Pro
‚Ä¢ July 29: Second round of delistings on Beta (BTC, ETH, SOL, SUI, WAL). These markets will be listed on Bluefin Pro and will be available for you to re-open your positions.
‚Ä¢ July 31: Sunset of Bluefin Beta

Please close open positions before each delisting deadline. Positions that have not been closed before the delisting time will be closed at the oracle price. You can continue trading and earning rewards on Beta until July 29. Bluefin Vaults will remain active and continue to earn beyond migration.

We will be publishing a detailed guide and FAQ in the coming days to help make this migration as smooth as possible for you.
tweets.author: bluefinapp

tweets.content:
1/ The Great Migration is here. Bluefin pioneered perps trading on @SuiNetwork, and over the past 648 days, Bluefin Perps Beta has processed over $55 billion in trading volume. 

With Bluefin Pro, we introduce a completely rebuilt perps exchange and are excited to take perps trading on Sui to new heights. As we launch Pro, Bluefin Perps Beta will gradually be sunsetted.

tweets.author: bluefinapp

tweets.content:
3/ Security as a System

Bluefin is the most audited and battle-tested protocol on Sui, with ongoing audits from @osec_io and @AsymptoticTech and a dedicated internal security team.

Security is an ongoing commitment, and these are some of the initiatives that we are investing in at Bluefin:

 ‚Ä¢ Formal verification of core libraries (localhost:8080/AsymptoticTech/status/‚Ä¶)
 ‚Ä¢ Weekly code reviews
 ‚Ä¢ Bug bounties
 ‚Ä¢ Internal coverage

We‚Äôll continue investing in formal verification, architecture reviews, and ecosystem-wide coordination to raise the bar for secure and verifiable DeFi.
tweets.author: bluefinapp

tweets.content:
2/ A Leading Aggregator on Sui

Bluefin7K is a widely used aggregator infrastructure on Sui, integrated with @lifiprotocol (powering swaps across @binance, @JumperExchange, and many other venues).

It extends Bluefin‚Äôs unique liquidity model across the ecosystem, routing through the deepest markets.

Bluefin Spot 2.0 means: smarter routing, broader integrations, and a vastly improved UX.
tweets.author: bluefinapp

tweets.content:
1/ Hybrid Liquidity: RFQ + CLMM

Bluefin combines the depth of passive LPs with the precision of RFQ (Request for quote) execution. This hybrid model delivers low slippage, MEV protection, and consistently better pricing.

RFQ is quickly emerging as a core primitive in DeFi. We‚Äôre scaling it fast and integrating it directly into our concentrated liquidity pools. This results in tighter spreads, faster fills, and better execution.
tweets.author: bluefinapp

tweets.content: What makes Bluefin Spot 2.0 the most advanced onchain DEX on Sui? Let's dive in üßµ
tweets.author: bluefinapp

tweets.content:
We‚Äôre excited to share a major milestone from our security partnership with @bluefinapp:

We‚Äôve completed the full formal verification of integer-mate, the library used across many Sui protocols. The latest version is now formally verified and provably correct.

During verification, we uncovered and responsibly disclosed a previously unknown bug. Thanks to the quick action and coordination by @SuiNetwork, an ecosystem-wide upgrade was swiftly deployed.

Don‚Äôt just trust, verify: you can independently read and run our formal specifications yourself.

Big thanks to @bluefinapp for hosting the formally-verified and improved version of this library and its executable specs for the community. You can check it out here: github.com/fireflyprotocol/i‚Ä¶

tweets.content: This launch marks a significant milestone for what‚Äôs possible on Sui! Bluefin Pro leverages Nautilus, running the matching engine in a trusted execution environment, to deliver millisecond-level order speeds without giving up decentralization, user custody, or verifiability.
tweets.author: bluefinapp

tweets.content:
A deep dive into Bluefin Pro by the team at Four Pillars ‚Äì one of the sharpest research firms in the space. Their article gets to the heart of why we built it the way we did.

Thank you @FourPillarsFP!
tweets.author: bluefinapp

tweets.content:
During formal verification of the integer-mate library (part of our collaboration with @bluefinapp üôè), we uncovered a subtle integer overflow bug in signed integer subtraction (sub).

We responsibly disclosed this to @SuiNetwork, who helped spread the word to affected DEXs so they could also fix this bug. And special thanks to @NotDeGhost from @osec_io for jumping in and helping throughout!

One impressive aspect was @bluefinapp‚Äôs rapid response, they had an upgrade ready almost immediately.

Now that everyone has safely upgraded, here are the details about the bug üßµ
tweets.author: bluefinapp

tweets.content:
During our ongoing formal verification with our partners at @AsymptoticTech, of integer-mate  ‚Äì a core math library used across many Sui protocols ‚Äì we identified an edge case where signed subtraction could behave incorrectly when the second operand reached its minimum possible value.

While the bug had no impact on Bluefin‚Äôs systems, the uncertainty around how others might use the library prompted us to act quickly - preparing an improved implementation with our security partners and working closely with Sui Foundation to spread the word to affected DEXs so they could fix this bug.

Thank you to everyone involved: @AsymptoticTech for the deep dive and spotting the edge case, @osec_io‚Äôs @NotDeGhost for jumping in on verification, and @SuiNetwork for leading a swift and coordinated response.

This is the kind of collaboration that sets Sui apart. Security is an ongoing commitment, and this quick identification and solve shows we're in this together.

We‚Äôll continue investing in formal verification, architecture reviews, and ecosystem-wide coordination to raise the bar for secure and verifiable DeFi.

tweets.author: bluefinapp

tweets.content:
6/ To date, we have completed six third-party audits across our AMM, perpetuals, and vaults infrastructure. We are expanding that scope, not just to what we build, but to every protocol we interact with.

On top of audits, we are layering in:

‚Ä¢ Internal red teaming
‚Ä¢ Formal verification
‚Ä¢ Incentive-driven discovery
‚Ä¢ Runtime circuit breakers

Security isn‚Äôt something we ‚Äúhave.‚Äù With every product released and increasing user deposits, it‚Äôs something we continually build. This is how we shift left, stay vigilant, and make Bluefin harder to break by design.
tweets.author: bluefinapp

tweets.content:
5/ Bug bounties are expanding ‚Äì and are a first-class part of our security model. We‚Äôve been live on @HackenProof since 2024, and have now significantly increased rewards to incentivize responsible disclosure. We are also publishing internal threat models to broaden the attack surface whitehats can meaningfully engage with. Combined with economic modelling, they form a parallel layer of defence that scales as we do.

Bluefin Spot bug bounty: hackenproof.com/programs/blu‚Ä¶
tweets.author: bluefinapp

tweets.content: 4/ We are also evolving our runtime defence posture. Drawing inspiration from DeFi primitives like Compound‚Äôs guardian actor, timelocks, and circuit breakers, each Bluefin protocol is being hardened with runtime fail-safes that automatically delay or throttle risky actions. For example, large withdrawals that deviate several standard deviations above historical norms will trigger temporary delays. In those windows, the system fails safe ‚Äì and a multisig guardian can accelerate approval if triage determines the behaviour is valid. These mechanisms are protocol-specific, adaptable, and designed to contain failure before it spreads.
tweets.author: bluefinapp

tweets.content: 3/ This is the start of a long-term relationship with Asymptotic across all Bluefin protocols. We are embedding formal verification into our continuous integration pipelines, especially in areas where invariants govern core value flows. As this evolves, we‚Äôll share more on our methodology and how we use the Sui Prover to enforce correctness at the spec level.
tweets.author: bluefinapp

tweets.content:
2/ Formal verification uses specifications and provers to mathematically prove that critical logic behaves as expected, catching bugs that tests and audits can easily miss. This post (localhost:8080/AsymptoticTech/status/‚Ä¶) demonstrates exactly how the recent exploit could have been avoided.

As part of our collaboration, we are simplifying complex methods, introducing reusable spec patterns, and publishing verified versions of common operations. The highest-priority functions, including those most relevant to recent vulnerabilities, will be verified by the end of this week, with full coverage to follow shortly after as a shared asset for the broader Sui ecosystem.
tweets.author: bluefinapp

tweets.content:
1/ At Bluefin, we have been investing in deeper security layers across the stack: formal verification, architecture, incentives, and layered defence.

We are now partnering with @AsymptoticTech to formally verify integer-mate ‚Äì the core math library powering AMMs and DeFi systems ‚Äì building on their groundbreaking work with the Sui Prover.
